intro: Rauvolfia anomala, commonly known as Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its roots have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their medicinal properties.
